subsection.title: 1. Find the coordinates of points on a parabola

introduction.p: To find the x-coordinate of a point on a parabola, we usually need to solve a quadratic equation.

statement.p: Find the y-coordinate of the point on the graph of ~y=2x^2-3x+5~ with x-coordinate -3.

solution.p: Substitute x=\alert{-3} into the equation, and evaluate. y=2(\alert{-3})^2-3(\alert{-3})+5 = 18+9+5 = 32 The y-coordinate is 32, and the point is (-3,32).

statement.p: Find the x-coordinates of all points on the graph of ~y=20-3x^2~ with y-coordinate -28.
Find the y-coordinate of the point on the graph of ~y=-x^2+6x+2~ with x-coordinate -2.
The x-coordinate of the vertex of ~y=2x^2-6x+1~ is \dfrac{3}{2}. Find the y-coordinate of the vertex.
Find the x-coordinates of all points on the graph of ~y=x^2-2x+5~ with y-coordinate 8.
Find the x-intercepts of the graph of ~y=\dfrac{1}{4}x^2-5x+24~.

subsection.title: 2. Find the average of two numbers

introduction.p: The average of two numbers lies half-way between them on a number line. To find their average, we take one-half of their sum. That is, the average of p and q is \dfrac{1}{2}(p+q)~~~~\text{or}~~~~\dfrac{p+q}{2}
